author: __flcl
content:
<@792822129019584562> <@425572898787426305> <@543900561460822016> <@898563924440543283> 
I'm a bit uncertain about header fields order, currently assuming
```
data_gas_used,
excess_data_gas
```
or you guys think this is better:
```
excess_data_gas,
data_gas_used,
```

author: m.kalinin
content: I don't see any difference here, the change proposed to the EIP uses the former. Whatever we choose should work but it should be consistent across the specs

author: hsiaowei
content: I have no preference but the (released) CL spec now follows EIP order.

author: m.kalinin
content: So, this is why I think in Engine API PR the order should be reversed considering an EIP as a source of it -- this is the only reasoning I have

author: m.kalinin
content: ok, then Engine API should follow it as well

author: __flcl
content:
Cool, I see not big difference too. Just do not want to remake it. 
data_gas_used, excess_data_gas

author: stefanbratanov
content: I think the engine api PR https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/417 already has the correct order. Just the file that is being commented on is outdated.

author: kanagwa
content:
Hi, I'm Gabi from the Blobscan team. We're collecting valuable feedback regarding the usage of the blob transactions under the upcoming Dencun fork by users and rollup chains.

We're interested in your insights and creative ideas for potential features you'd like to see incorporated into the block explorer web app (https://blobscan.com/) we're developing for this new type of transactions. Perhaps there are certain types of metrics, specific analytical components, visualization elements, or transaction details you would like to see? . We're also in the process of creating a dedicated API and would appreciate any input you have to offer. If you can spare a few minutes, please complete our Google form: https://forms.gle/KXASChJXCuwVcAxs6

In addition, if you're involved with a rollup project, we'd love the opportunity to connect with you directly. Please feel free to send me a private message here on Discord, contact us on our discord (https://discord.gg/WdgDVK2UPA) or schedule a time to chat via my Calendly link: https://calendly.com/0xgabi/30

author: marioevz
content:
Hi all, the hive engine-api test suite for devnet-6 has been updated and I have posted the instructions to run them over here: https://notes.ethereum.org/@marioevz/hive-engine-api-blobs

If any clients need help running their branches with this test suite just let me know and I can help with that.
